roles: Bachelor of Arts in Economics graduate
supporting_quotes: She was then admitted to the University of Botswana, graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in Economics.

roles: Master of Science in International Economics graduate
supporting_quotes: Later, she obtained a Master of Science in International Economics from the University of Sussex in the United Kingdom.
After her postgraduate studies at the University of Sussex in the United Kingdom as Chevening Scholar, earning an Msc International Economics
She received training in Economic Freedom Philosophy from the Foundation for Economic Education.

organizations: Ghanaian Ministry of Trade and Industry
supporting_quotes: Kenewendo worked as a trade economist ODI Fellow in the Ghanaian Ministry of Trade and Industry.
She also served as an economic consultant at Econsult Botswana, a Gaborone-based think tank.
In 2016, the then president of Botswana, Ian Khama, nominated Kenewendo to the Parliament of Botswana, where she was elected as a presidential nominee to parliament.
Member of the Parliament of Botswana In office 27 October 2016 – 04 April 2018

roles: Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry
supporting_quotes: On 4 April 2018, the new incoming president, Mokgweetsi Masisi, appointed Kenewendo as the new Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry.
Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry In office 4 April 2018 – November 2019

organizations: United Nations Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation
supporting_quotes: In her capacity as minister, Kenewendo was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation, co-chaired by Melinda Gates and Jack Ma.
Member of the United Nations Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation In office 12 July 2018 – November 2019
Kenewendo was cited as one of the Top 100 most influential Africans by New African magazine in 2018.
After being dropped from cabinet in November 2019 she has served as the managing director of Kenewendo Advisory, based in Gaborone, Botswana.

organizations: Molaya Kgosi Women Leadership and Mentorship Program
supporting_quotes: She leads Molaya Kgosi Women Leadership and Mentorship Program
and the Board Chair of Molaya Kgosi Trust.

When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021, Kenewendo was appointed by the country's Minister for Women and Equalities, Liz Truss, to a newly formed Gender Equality Advisory Council (GEAC) chaired by Sarah Sands.

organizations: United Nations Climate Change High-Level Champions
supporting_quotes: In June 2022, Kenewendo was appointed as Special Advisor and Africa Director to the United Nations Climate Change High-Level Champions.
Special Advisor and Africa Director to the United Nations Climate Change High-Level Champions Incumbent Assumed office June 2022
She serves as a Specially Elected Member of Parliament in the Botswana Parliament as of November 2024
The year 2024 set a different tone for Kenewendo and Botswana as she was specially elected to be a Member of Parliament under the new administration
she is the incumbent Minister of Minerals and Energy in the current administration
and was sworn in as minister of Minerals and Energy.
Minister of Minerals and Energy Incumbent Assumed office November 2024
